website_summaries.verdict: TRAC’s Pontoon 35 is a slim, yet strong electric anchor winch that retrieves an anchor speedily, is easy to install, and is an affordable investment.
pros: Includes 100ft of double braid anchor rope
cons: This electric anchor winch’s controls are built-in to the unit, but a remote control would have been more convenient

customer_reviews.title: Didn't last long
customer_reviews.text: I used this winch with a 20lb anchor, well below it' rated capacity... It only lasted about 10 trips out on the lake. There were plastic shavings after about 6 uses and I had to help it retrieve the 20lb anchor. Would not buy again.
customer_reviews.author: Scott Czerwinski

customer_reviews.title: Durablity "NOT"
customer_reviews.text: Second time out with 18 lb anchor, the motor is burnt up. Completely useless. Does this thing even have a warranty?
customer_reviews.author: Melissa L.

customer_reviews.title: This is more for the character of Amazon's customer service Representatives
customer_reviews.text: I purchased one of these that was described as a blem and was at a reduced price. When it got to my house it was damaged and broken and unusable. After calling Amazon Prime and describing what was going on to the representative he without question returned my money, and was as friendly as friendly could be and understanding to the predicament I was in. kudos to the people who work for this company. As for the product itself I can't really say but from what I saw it is a nice compact easy-to-use unit can't wait to get one that is not damaged and try it out.
customer_reviews.author: Mr Penny

customer_reviews.title: It is also very nice not to have a pile of rope inside the ...
customer_reviews.text: Fishing on rivers that aren't completely still proved to be quite difficult when it came time to pull in the anchor. This winch has saved me tons of time and stress getting the boat moving again. It is also very nice not to have a pile of rope inside the boat. For the price if you have the space and even a semi need for this I would suggest buying one. 5 stars all the way "said my back".
customer_reviews.author: Larry

customer_reviews.title: Motor quit forth time using. Spool is plastic. Screws rust first time wet.
customer_reviews.text: Bought two, one still in the box. Hurricane Michael kept us from using until this past week. Forth time pulling up a 20 pound anchor, the motor quit. Checked and has power to the motor. Went on a Face book pontoon page to ask if anyone else had the problem. Had several replies, all bad. Would like to return and buy a better pontoon anchor winch. Tried to call TRAC, message said their box was full, please hang up. Amazon has my email address. sonandersonsr866@gmail.com
customer_reviews.author: Son Anderson

customer_reviews.title: Nice addition to the pontoon boat
customer_reviews.text: Second set. We only got about 2 1/2 years of life out of the first set and that was with just occasional weekend use on our pontoon but we figure they sit out in the elements all summer long (stored inside during the winter). They are much nicer than having to pull wet, dirty anchor up and sit on the boat this way they dangle over the edge out of the way and don't make a mess on the boat.
customer_reviews.author: Office Mom

customer_reviews.title: Damaged product.
customer_reviews.text: When I went to install the wench today 4/22/2019 I noticed the product was damaged and didn't think about the time line to send back,now I'm stuck with a damaged product I can't use or return. All I want to do is exchange for another one. On these things like this there should not be a time line to return if it shows up damaged inside the box when you install at a later date.
customer_reviews.author: John Starks

customer_reviews.title: So far so good...
customer_reviews.text: So far so good. Easy install and easily pulls my mushroom anchor up from a muddy bottom river. much simpler than a pile of rope and chain on the deck of the boat.
customer_reviews.author: Ryan Hall

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: 2nd I've purchased, work very well, wish I'd have gotten them years ago
customer_reviews.author: Tim Schnackenberg

customer_reviews.title: Not reliable
customer_reviews.text: In February 2020 I bought a new pontoon boat and mounted 2 of these front and back with remotes. Both units hooked up identical and worked great for awhile. Went fishing 3-4 times and had anchors up and down maybe 2 dozen times. I am using 15 lb anchors. Front unit no longer works. Checked fuse, battery and wiring everything looks good. The motor on the winch just stopped working. Very limited use and undersized anchor. Not sure what to do but very disappointed with this.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Jesus
customer_reviews.text: Works great, But needs to be a little stronger sometimes it trips and you have to wait a good while for it to reset. That being said it's still worth it I have a 2016 Tritoon pontoon Head to mount it between the Tritoons It is a back saver and neck saver.
customer_reviews.author: Rob W.

customer_reviews.title: Would recommend
customer_reviews.text: I like the product, but when I went to get the extra switch , at the bottom where is says we recommend this item. Fine but the item they showed was the wrong ends.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: does well on lake erie - only draw back? a little slow on deployment
customer_reviews.author: derek lisi

customer_reviews.title: Borderline junk
customer_reviews.text: Well first day out with this setup and got to say im utterly disappointed. 30# mushroom anchor and had to keep stopping while pulling up because the breaker would pop. Gonna switch to a 20# and see if it works better and put the 30# in the corner of garage. Dont waste your money on this turd.
customer_reviews.author: Bobby G

customer_reviews.title: did not blow fuse ,when it was overloaded
customer_reviews.text: motor burnt up because some one hit up on remote ,when it was already up.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Motor not working after 4 months use
customer_reviews.text: Put on pontoon in May and now it's September and the motor doesn't work .. is there a warranty on this?
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Week winch
customer_reviews.text: Not very strong. If you get your anchor stuck best to use your boat to pull it loose not this winch. This was my second purchase. So far this one is holding up.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Duff

customer_reviews.title: It works
customer_reviews.text: I'm using it for my 20' pontoon boat. Easy install.
customer_reviews.author: Joe Kleindorfer

customer_reviews.title: It does not come with enough wire for a 24' pontoon.
customer_reviews.text: But it works well. I thought it may not do well with a large boat, but surprisingly it does. We anchor in about 60' of water and it held pretty well. We even got into a little bit of wind and rain, and it held us well to my surprising.
customer_reviews.author: jennifer

customer_reviews.title: If they say New, and it looks used, don’t accept it.
customer_reviews.text: Sad, I was so excited to get the 35 for the bow, because I have a 25 aft. The ad said it was new-what a scam. Somebody unloaded this unit cause it was tampered with. Ya know, when you think you are buying new the distributor unloads a POS on you, sad. It took a while to trailer the pontoon so I could wire the anchor in, so I know the 30 days to return has passed. The unit spools but as soon as the weight of the anchor picks up the motor quits. Then you have to play with the switches just to get it to spool again. Sad.
customer_reviews.author: Jayne Lynn Kushner

customer_reviews.title: Keep throwing your anchor!
customer_reviews.text: I should have paid attention to all the bad reviews.Could have saved myself a lot of time. Would not even retrieve a 12 lb mushroom anchor an inch before “whining”. Please stop selling these.
customer_reviews.author: bmc

customer_reviews.title: Great anchor and very quiet
customer_reviews.text: It is quiet and does a very good job of picking up in mud
customer_reviews.author: stephen carscadden

customer_reviews.title: Winch
customer_reviews.text: Installed on my pontoon and love it. Allows us to dock in the water without beaching the boat.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Plenty of power to pull my anchor up loaded with weeds!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for a 24ft pontoon. My anchor holds in 40ft of water and has the power to pull the anchor up loaded with weeds.
customer_reviews.author: rsallen56

customer_reviews.title: Did what it was supposed to do
customer_reviews.text: Install was very easy. We used it on the lake once so far and it worked perfectly
customer_reviews.author: TimC

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: so far this is working like a charm very pleased and would recommend for all boat owners
customer_reviews.author: Danny Storey

customer_reviews.title: Worth the money.
customer_reviews.text: Put 2 of these on the front corners of our pontoon. Easy to install and use. It’s an excellent product.
customer_reviews.author: Katrina Lickley

customer_reviews.title: Very nice Pontoon winch.
customer_reviews.text: Came in a very timely manner from the seller. It was exactly as advertised. They had plenty in stock and it works very well. My pontoon has a railing with a hole cut in it for an anchor winch. This extended out perfectly through the hole to reach out over the deck to reach the water. There is a metal pipe at the bottom of the railing across the deck floor,so I had to put a 1 1/2" board under the winch to raise it up. The screws that came with it were long enough to go through the winch, board, and decking of the boat.
customer_reviews.author: rsmith2534

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: This is my second one and no more rope to pull!!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Broke second time it was used
customer_reviews.text: Second time I used it the spool broke trying to pull up a 20# river anchor.
customer_reviews.author: Roger Hallum

customer_reviews.title: Disastrous finishing
customer_reviews.text: Acabado desastrozo, tuve que finalizarlo yo, no creo que soporte por mucho tiempo la interperie porque la base es de acero. Lo repare y lo instale y todavia funciona despues de 2 meses Disastrous finishing, I had to finish it myself, I do not think it will stand for long the interperie because the base is made of steel. I repair it and install it and it still works after 2 months
customer_reviews.author: Simpson

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: Not too bad of a setup so far works very well
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Poor product
customer_reviews.text: Poor product. If your a fisherman and you fish different honey holes, don't buy this product as there is no "free wheel" to allow u to drop your anchor really fast as the outgoing motor is very slow and by the time the anchor sets, you have already passed over your honey hole. The rope it comes with is so thin it's hard to grasp it in your hands to pull the anchor up of needed. I use a 30lb river anchor with product
customer_reviews.author: warren

customer_reviews.title: JUNK
customer_reviews.text: Lasted three trips, began rusting (Cover screws and base plate, leaveing stains on my new boat)within a week. stopped working within three weeks.
customer_reviews.author: POP

customer_reviews.title: Horrible Return Policy!!
customer_reviews.text: Do not buy this product unless you are 100% sure it will work. The footprint of the motor is larger then expected, and if you have to return it, it is extremely expensive! I bought these for my Dad hoping to surprise him. Turns out they are too big for his boat, return shipping for 2 of these was over $100, plus a 20% restocking fee! I will never buy from these guys again! Buyer Beware!!
customer_reviews.author: Genevieve

product_meta.title: Pontoon 35 Electric Anchor Winch
product_meta.description: Pontoon 35 Electric Anchor Winch Pontoon 35 Electric Anchor Winch will power up and down your anchor with anti-reverse internal clutch to prevent free-spooling. Specifics Maximum Anchor Capacity: 30-35 lbs. Typical Boat Length: up to 22′ Speed up: 65 ft/min Speed down: 70 ft/min Integrated roller davit Winch Dimensions (LxWxH): 19.5″ x 9.75″ x 5.75″ Davit Dimensions (LxWxH): Included above All Anchor Winch models include: Rugged All-Steel Gears 100’ of 0.20” pre-wound braided anchor rope Automatic resetting circuit breaker Sealed membrane UP/DOWN switch 14-gauge marine-grade battery wire Anchor safety chain Assembly hardware and instructions. Due to size/weight there may be additional shipping charges outside of the contiguous USA

specifications.Customer Reviews: 3.9 out of 5 stars122 ratings3.9 out of 5 stars
